posts.title: HTML API Project
posts.body: In this project, I learned basic HTML and how an API works This project was more about understanding what goes behind the scenes of React and HTTP requests

posts.title: Cinema App
posts.body: This is my first big project, I used 2 different APIs one of them is reading data from a JSON file and implanting it in the API both are connected to the DB.

posts.title: Whatsapp Clone
posts.body: In This Project, I learned about WebSockets and socket.io and improved my React coding skills ( Importing technique, new Hooks, Folders arrangement )

posts.title: E-commerce
posts.body: This project was more about approaching the e-commerce market and learning how to implant payments via stripe

posts.title: todos
posts.body: In this project I practiced redux, state management, and the parent and child concept also I learned the technology of JSONSERVER which lets you build a fast project with persisted DB without creating one

posts.title: Portfolio Website
posts.body:
I built my portfolio website using react and SCSS.
I learned about DNS, how to deploy a project and responsive design concepts.
3 important subjects to the start of my coding journey

posts.title: Shoply System Orders Dashboard
posts.body:
My first developing project in my first company.
In this project ,I needed to fetch data from a Wordpress site and present it in realtime in a dashboard.
This project was a big challenge because the company used servel tools to build their site including python,
PHP,node which made me learn webhooks and different HTTP methods than axios adding to this i ran by a CORS problem so i learned on my skin how to deal with it
the problem was that i sent requests to localhost from a AWS server than i deployed my project on AWS with EC2 and made systemd service to make it run on startup

posts.title: Shoply System Time Log Dashboard
posts.body:
similar to the Orders Dashboard I needed to fetch the data from WordPress and present the time of every status update.
most of the technologies that I used remained the same except using google API to save the data logs in Google sheets

posts.title: Shoply V2 API
posts.body: Shoply is making a shift from WordPress to Vue/Laravel so I started to make the API routes to the credit card, mail, messages etc...

posts.title: Shoply V2 SQL Tables export with API
posts.body: We had a demand for exporting all of the tables of the Wordpress Shoply while filtering some of the columns so I needed first to build an API that will filter and arrange all of the requested data and than export it to an exterior database.

posts.title: Vue Crash Course
posts.body: Took a course in Udemy which taught me the fundamentals of Vue: files structure, data binding, reactivity, routing and state management

posts.title: Coding Blog
posts.body: Implanted all of the knowledge from the Vue crash course to build an application that serves my needs to document my coding journey.

posts.title: Virtual Machine
posts.body: as part of a mission that I assigned to I needed to learn what is a virtual machine how it works and how to control it

posts.title: Making a Local Development Workspace For Shoply
posts.body:
Until now we worked on the remote of the Shoply system so we didn't have a good control on our versions so we had the need for a local workspace.
I worked on making a VM image with homestead/Laravel and imported all of the SQL data of Shoply system then I uploaded it all to GitHub with git.

posts.title: Printers Code
posts.body:
leanred the code of the Shoply system printers it takes data from the client to node.js and prints it with a python script.
gave me a better understanding of the system and of algorithm and script because the code was loaded with logic.

posts.title: Shoply System Documentation
posts.body: made a documentation for the shoply system

posts.title: Pytest
posts.body:
Learned how to run tests on a python script with the pytest libarary.
made few tries with basic functions checking varibales and functions returns and ended out testing a flask restapi which shows out the potenial of pytest as you can test http headers,data,response...

posts.title: API With Flask
posts.body:
got introduced to flask , created basic rest api with get,getById,post,put,delete and played with it.
practiced pytest on it to relize what data i can pull from it.
to conclude flask is a very easy and fast api to set up perfect for dev projects.

posts.title: Todos Project
posts.body:
Started this project with the goal to practice typescript with redux toolkit.
refreshed my membory on the redux toolkit syntax,used thunk with toolkit and typescript, used persist with toolkit.
in this project i made a bad parent/child realtions so i took notes to my next project to focus on building a more modular relation.

posts.title: Weather Project
posts.body:
Made another Weather Project, my first one was an interview home task for Herolo in javascript in basic redux.
this time i made in in typescript and redux toolkit.
parcticed the parent/child relations and made a very modular project the usage of typescript contributed to it alot, ended up with a clean code a thing which i want to maintain

posts.title: Git Branches
posts.body: Started on adding braches to my git repos to have a more organized GitHub profile.

posts.title: Java basics
posts.body: Started a Computer Science course in the Open Univertsity of Israel on this week i learnt the basics of java.

posts.title: Programmed Varios Features On My Work
posts.body:
In the most of this week we had alot of improvements in the UI/UX and varios changes on the products features.
it gave me time to practice my css and jquery skills in addition to that cleaning and reading alot of code lines as well.

posts.title: Cleaned Messy Code
posts.body: as part of changes to some features in our code I had to clean a lot of messy code to improve readability and modularity

posts.title: Making a shift to a new API
posts.body: our company made a decision to switch one of our current APIs to improve performance so I'm making all of the endpoints and syncing it with the depot printers.

posts.title: Daniel's Resort Landing Page
posts.body:
starting making a landing page for a client that approached me 
for his business.

posts.title: Chess Assignment
posts.body:
made the chess assignment of the open university in java.
practiced syntax and had fun with algorithmic thinking.

posts.title: Implementing the new API in my company system
posts.body: after building all of the endpoints I cleared all of the old API code and prepared the production for the new API prepared ( testing, sanity checks )

posts.title: Fixed Major Production Bug
posts.body: the printers code stopped working this week so I had to find a way to fix it. in the end I found a bug in the server so I reset the AWS server files and services to have this bug fixed.

posts.title: Synced Dev and Prod files
posts.body: to have a better workflow I decided to sync the files Between Dev and Prod.

posts.title: UX Development To The Checkout Area
posts.body: after watching the data of our checkout the company decided to improve the UX of the checkout to improve sales.

posts.title: Webhooks To The New API
posts.body: Made webhooks to the API I implanted so evreytime the a order is getting changed in the api dashboard it updates the order status in our system.

posts.title: Checkout Area UX/UI
posts.body: I am keeping suggesting improvements to the checkout area to improve the company funnels and implementing the relevant suggestions that are brought up by our workers.

posts.title: Updated Code Blog Project
posts.body:
Updated code blog modal so I can add technologies that I used in each post.
Also I had duplicate code from prop drilling ( styles and http requests ) so I cleaned it out of the code.

posts.title: Moved the new API to production and kept testing it
posts.body:
Moved the new API to production and kept testing the get,post,put,delete and webhooks.
also our company brought up some things that needs to be configured so we arranged a meeting with the API developers and got on the same page

posts.title: Classes and Methods Assignment
posts.body: Some genral classes usage in Java, gave me practice in OOP.

posts.title: Started Working as a Freelancer
posts.body: Started Working as a freelancer for my former CTO,for a start im working on basic Wordpress Projects

posts.title: Documented Shoply System
posts.body: Documented the entire shoply system as part of finishing my position in the company.

posts.title: Converted MyBundles Project From Javascript to Typescript
posts.body:
This project had servel bugs so I decided to convert it to typescript which solved all of the bugs.
this showed me the potenial of Typescript in debugging

posts.title: Tested The New API
posts.body: Tested the new API I implamented,as of today it being tested in the field by our drivers.

posts.title: Developed Varios Assignments
posts.body: Developed varios assignmets for my last week in My Bundles including checkout ux,printers integration,filtering products and autocomplete functions.

posts.title: Created Workspaces and Started Developing As A Freelance
posts.body:
Created most of the FTP connection of my client and started developing little things in Wordpress sites.
I'm finding it very challenging because most of my client's clients sites are a big code spaghetti which means I need to find a sophisticated solution for an easy problem

posts.title: Developed Assignments for Gingim
posts.body: Developed a page that pulls data from SQL DB and from Wordpress posts and a small algorithm that show the data according to the client's requests.

posts.title: Arrays and Classes Assignment
posts.body: Developed an Airport Schedule using arrays in java.

posts.title: Developed Reactive SPA for Gingim Site
posts.body: With Ajax calls I made a reactive SPA that update Wordpress Data and the frontend according to the client action.

posts.title: Polymorphism Assignment
posts.body: Completed the assignment in polymorphism in java

posts.title: Started New Position in Spinomenal
posts.body: Started New Position as a Fullstack Developer in Spinomenal, iGaming Company Who Develops Games For Casinos.

posts.body: Developed my first feature which improves productivity in our company

posts.title: Working On An Existing Old Project
posts.body: Working on a project which involves filtering duplicate code and making it more readable and improving the frontend side of it.

posts.body: Completed the assignment in recursive programming in java

posts.body: Worked on an assignment which included creating animation and a responsive design of a feature
